intro: Viguiera lepidostephana, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces showy, purple to pinkish flower clusters that bloom in late summer to early fall. Viguiera lepidostephana is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
